He cymð & fordeð þa tiligean & sylð oþron þone wingeard.
WSCp MARK 12.10 Ne rædde ge þis gewrit;
Se stan þe þa wyrhtan awurpon, þes ys geworden on þære hyrnan heafod.
WSCp MARK 12.11 Þis ys fram Drihtne geworden
& hit is wundorlic on uron eagum.
WSCp MARK 12.12 Þa smeadon hi þæt hi gefengon hine
& hi ondredon þa menigu;
Hi oncneowon þa þæt he þis bigspell to him sæde;
Hi ferdon þa & hine forleton.
WSCp MARK 12.13 Þa sendon hi to him sume of Phariseum & Herodianum þæt hi befengon hine on his worde.
WSCp MARK 12.14 Ða comon hi & þus mid facne cwædon,
lareow, we witon þæt þu eart soðfæst
& þu ne recst be ænegum menn
ne besceawast þu manna ansyne,
ac þu Godes weg lærst on soðfæstnysse;
Alyfð gaful to syllanne þam Casere.
WSCp MARK 12.15 Hwæðer þe we ne syllað;
þa cwæð he & heora lotwrencceaste wiste,
hwi fandi ge min;
Bringað me þone pening þæt ic hine geseo.
WSCp MARK 12.16 Þa brohton hi him
þa sæde he him,
hwæs is þeos anlicnys & þis gewrit;
Hi cwædon,
ðæs Caseres.
WSCp MARK 12.17 Ða cwæð se hælend to him,
agyfað þam Casere þa ðing þe þæs Caseres synd, & Gode þa ðe Godes synd;
þa wundrodon hi be þam.
WSCp MARK 12.18 Þa comon him to Sadcei þa secgað þæt ærist ne sy & hine ahsodon & þus cwædon.
WSCp MARK 12.19 Lareow, Moyses us wrat, gif hwæs broðor dead bið & læfð his wif & næfð nan bearn þæt his broðor nime his wif & his broðor sæd wecce.
WSCp MARK 12.20 Eornostlice seofon gebroþru wæron
& se æresta nam wif & wearð dead na læfedum sæde.
WSCp MARK 12.21 And þa nam se oðer hi & wearð dead
ne se sæd ne læfde;
Gelice se þridda.
WSCp MARK 12.22 & ealle seofon hi hæfdon & sæd ne læfdon;
Ealra æftemest þa forðferde þæt wif.
WSCp MARK 12.23 On þam æriste, hwylces þara seofona bið þæt wif;
Hi ealle hi hæfdon.
WSCp MARK 12.24 Þa andswarode him se hælend,
hu ne dweligað ge forþam þe ge nyton þa halgan gewritu ne Godes mægen?
WSCp MARK 12.25 Soðlice þonne hi of deaðe arisaþ ne wifiaþ hi ne ne gyftigeað,
ac hi synt swylce Godes englas on heofonum.
WSCp MARK 12.26 Be þam deadum þæt hi arison, ne rædde ge on Moyses bec hu God to him cwæþ ofer þone gorstbeam,
ic eom Abrahames God & Isaaces God & Iacobes God.
WSCp MARK 12.27 Nis God deadra
ac he hys lybbendra;
Soðlice swyþe ge dweligeað.
WSCp MARK 12.28 Ða genealæhte him an of þam bocerum þe he gehyrde hi smeagende & geseah þæt he him wel andswarode & ahsode hine, hwæt wære ealra beboda mæst?
WSCp MARK 12.29 Þa andswarode he him,
þæt is þæt mæste bebod ealra,
Israhel, gehyr,
urne Drihten God he is.
WSCp MARK 12.30 And lufa þinne Drihten God of ealre þinre heortan & of ealre þinre sawle eallum þinum mode & of eallum þinum mægene;
þæt is þæt fyrmeste bebod.
WSCp MARK 12.31 Soðlice is oðer þissum gelic,
lufa þinne nehstan swa þe sylfne;
Nys oðer mare bebod.
WSCp MARK 12.32 Ða cwæþ se bocere,
Lareow, well þu on soþe cwæde þæt an God is & nis oðer butan him.
WSCp MARK 12.33 & ðæt he si gelufod of ealre heortan & of eallum andgyte & of ealre sawle & of ealre strengðe, & lufigean his nehstan swa hine sylfne; þæt is mare eallum onsægdnyssum & offrungum.
WSCp MARK 12.34 Ða se hælend geseah þæt he him wislice andwyrde he sæde him,
ne art þu feorr fram Godes rice;
& hine ne dorste nan mann ahsian.
WSCp MARK 12.35 Ða cwæþ se hælend on þam temple lærende,
hu secgað þa boceras þæt Crist sy Dauides sunu?
WSCp MARK 12.36 Dauid sylf cwæþ to þam halgan gaste;
Drihten cwæþ to minum Drihtne,
site on mine swyðran healfe oð ic þine fynd asette to fotsceamole þinra fota.
WSCp MARK 12.37 Dauid sylf nemde hine Drihten,
& hwanon is he his sunu;
And mycel menegu hine luflice gehyrde.
WSCp MARK 12.38 Þa sæde he him on his lare,
warniað fram bocerum þa wyllað on gegyrlum gan & beon on strætum grete. WSCp MARK 12.39 & on fyrmestum lareowsetlum sittan on gesamnungum & þa fyrmestan setl on gebeorscipum.
WSCp MARK 12.40 Þa ðe wudewena hus forswelgað mid heora langsuman gebede; þa onfoð lengestne dom.
WSCp MARK 12.41 Ða sæt se hælend ongen þone tollsceamol & geseah hu þæt folc hyra feoh torfude on þone tollsceamul
& manega welige torfudon fela.
WSCp MARK 12.42 Þa com an earm wuduwe and wearp twegen feorðlingas.
